item.title: Lisi add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Lisi add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "Where there is great love, there are always miracles." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Lisi add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "And now the old story has begun to write itself over there," said Carl softly. "Isnâ€™t it queer: there are only two or three human stories, and they go on repeating themselves as fiercely as if they had never happened before; like the larks in this country, that have been singing the same five notes for thousands of years." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Lisi add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lisi add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Lisi add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Lisi add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Lisi add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Lisi add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Lisi add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I always deserve the best treatment because I never put up with any other." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Lisi add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "What are men to rocks and mountains?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Lisi add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Lisi add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Lisi add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "If music be the food of love, play on, Give me excess of it; that surfeiting, The appetite may sicken, and so die." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Lisi add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Lisi add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Sigh no more, ladies, sigh no more, Men were deceivers ever,- One foot in sea and one on shore, To one thing constant never." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Lisi add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Good name in man and woman, dear my lord, Is the immediate jewel of their souls: Who steals my purse steals trash; â€™tis something, nothing; â€™twas mine, â€™tis his, and has been slave to thousands; But he that filches from me my good name Robs me of that which not enriches him, And makes me poor indeed." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Lisi add a quote by Marvin J. Ashton
item.description: "Be the one who nurtures and builds. Be the one who has an understanding and a forgiving heart one who looks for the best in people. Leave people better than you found them." -- Marvin J. Ashton
